D.C. Resolution 20-248, effective July 10, 2013

20 DCSTAT 2105

A RESOLUTION

Proposed
Resolution
20-392
See Emergency
D.C. Act 20-143
20 DCStat 1990

To declare the existence of an emergency with respect to the need to amend the District of Columbia
Election Code of 1955 and the Campaign Finance Reform and Conflict of Interest Public
Disclosure Amendment Act of 2011 to reflect all elected offices in relevant sections.

RESOLVED, BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this
resolution may be cited as the "Election Code Conforming Emergency Declaration Resolution
of 2013".

Sec. 2. (a) There exists an immediate need to amend the District of Columbia Election
Code of 1955 and the Campaign Finance Reform and Conflict of Interest Public Disclosure
Amendment Act of 2011 to reflect all elected offices in advance of the 2014 primary.
(b) The laws must be updated to reflect the number of signatures necessary for
nominating petitions; recount procedures for all elected offices; candidacy limitations;
limitations on honoraria and royalties; and fundraising limits for all candidates in advance of the
2014 primary.
Sec. 3. The Council of the District of Columbia determines that the circumstances
enumerated in section 2 constitute emergency circumstances making it necessary that the
Election Code Conforming Emergency Amendment Act of 2013 be adopted after a single
reading.
Sec. 4. This resolution shall take effect immediately.
